verses.text:
Sav-ior! thy dy-ing love Thou gav-est me,
Nor should I aught with-hold, Dear Lord, from thee;
In love my soul would bow, My heart ful-fill its vow,
Some off-'ring bring thee now, Some-thing for thee.

At the blest mer-cy seat, Plead-ing for me,
My fee-ble faith looks up, Je-sus, to thee;
Help me the cross to bear, Thy wond-rous love de-clare,
Some song to raise, or pray'r, Some-thing for thee.

Give me a faith-ful heart, Like-ness to thee,
That each de-part-ing day Hence-forth may see
Some work of love be-gun, Some deed of kind-ness done,
Some wan-d'rer sought and won, Some-thing for thee.

All that I am and have, Thy gifts so free,
In joy, in grief, thro' life, Dear Lord, for thee!
And when thy face I see, My ran-somed soul shall be
Thro' all e-ter-ni-ty, Some-thing for thee.
